commit 8c9f13da9beb86a874ec603ff300548752a3721b
Author: Rebecca Nealon <rebecca.nealon@warwick.ac.uk>
Date:   Thu Aug 31 16:16:35 2023 +0100

    (apr) relaxing on the first step implemented + WendlandC2 is the default
    
    With KERNEL=cubic, the initial perturbation in force is reduced and in density is increased when relaxing is implemented. However, with KERNEL=WendlandC2 the initial density perturbation is relatively small (but in force is larger).

commit c80a93764ecf7bb8bb9e7ff37b06dcd1b81d9bef
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>
Date:   Thu Mar 24 10:24:06 2022 +1100

    MPI and OpenMP memory allocation optimisations (#262)
    
    Type of PR:
    modification to existing code
    
    Description:
    This PR combines several changes to memory allocation:
    - Rename `mpi_stack.F90` to `mpi_memory.F90` to reflect the fact that the structure is not strictly a memory stack
    - Move mpi memory allocation from initial into the main memory allocation subroutine
    - Set the MPI "stacksize" dynamically, based on `npart` and `nprocs`
    - Remove `remote_export` from the cell derived types, and adjust send/recv subroutines to match - this allows the `maxprocs` parameter to be removed
    - Remove `maxprocs` parameter and allocate arrays dynamically using `nprocs`
    - Automatically expand `stacksize` as required
    - Add check for if global node refinment exceeds ncellsmax (which is an issue for large numbers of MPI tasks)
    - Allocate a larger array for the global tree (using `ncellsmaxglobal` instead of `ncellsmax`)
    - Move dynamic memory size calculation inside the `allocate_memory` subroutine
    - Tidy up some unused imports
    - Fix setdisc test failure due to uninitialised (but unused) variables
    
    Resolve #260
    The crash is caused by large `threadprivate` arrays being allocated for certain numbers of MPI tasks and OpenMP threads. The root cause has not been identified, and is potentially a compiler bug.
    
    Two possible solutions:
    1. Dynamically allocate a separate `xyzcache` array for each thread (or one large array that is split between tasks). This solution essentially makes the memory allocation a manual/explicit process, since `threadprivate` _already_ performs a "dynamic" allocation at runtime based on `OMP_NUM_THREADS`. After discussion with @danieljprice, this solution was not preferred because:
    
    - The cache size is fixed per thread (though the total memory allocation still varies with the number of threads)
    - Performance may be affected. However, a test of the polar benchmark showed no change in performance for 1 and 2 node hybrid jobs. Interestingly, the new version produced slightly faster run times, but not with any significance.
    - Additional code complexity
    
    2. Reduce the cache size to work around the bug. Performance may not be affected, based on discussion with @danieljprice:
    
    _xyzcache does not have to be 50,000 long. Typically the number of trial neighbours is more like a few hundred, so something like 10,000 or even 5,000 for xyzcache length is already plenty_
    
    Option 2 has been chosen, with cache size reduced to 10,000. This works around the issue for 2 nodes, but the problem may still exist at other task+thread counts or other systems. This can be revisited if a more robust solution is required.
    
    Testing:
    - Benchmark suite to assess performance impact
    - Test suite for correctness
    
    Did you run the bots? yes

commit f42bab72cf2c5185a44fa2e7858e53b769838be4

    MPI and OpenMP memory allocation optimisations (#262)
    
    Type of PR:
    modification to existing code
    
    Description:
    This PR combines several changes to memory allocation:
    - Rename `mpi_stack.F90` to `mpi_memory.F90` to reflect the fact that the structure is not strictly a memory stack

    - Benchmark suite to assess performance impact
    - Test suite for correctness

commit 98af0eeff942027823d1f5d30179825e0b20668d
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>
Date:   Fri Mar 11 14:17:49 2022 +1100

    bugfix: initialise npartx (#265)
    
    npartx is not initialised, so the default number of particles takes on a garbage value, resulting in non-deterministic behaviour. This is often larger than maxp, causing the setup to fail in the build suite.
    
    Default value set to 100.

commit 398af00cac047e2230ca0cad52a1f0af38f8e42c
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>
Date:   Fri Mar 11 14:17:49 2022 +1100

    bugfix: initialise npartx (#265)
    
    npartx is not initialised, so the default number of particles takes on a garbage value, resulting in non-deterministic behaviour. This is often larger than maxp, causing the setup to fail in the build suite.
    
    Default value set to 100.

commit 13127df47343120ec432860c77cfc88282894a61
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>
Date:   Thu Mar 10 16:05:54 2022 +1100

    Optimisations for single task MPI (#259)
    
    Optimisations to reduce unnecessary calls when compiling with `MPI=yes` but running with only 1 MPI task. This will allow the code to always be compiled with MPI enabled, even for pure OMP runs, with no loss of performance.
    
    - Don't loop over all particles when balancing
    - Don't build or walk global tree

commit 196c713d6126097746a0ead2ea7d18353932e568
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>

    - Don't loop over all particles when balancing
    - Don't build or walk global tree

commit a09aa0748b562e1924ab1da493d5df0524ea4b6c
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>
Date:   Mon Mar 7 22:00:35 2022 +1100

    Refactor timing routines (#254)
    
    Makes the timing hierarchy clearer using a tree diagram. E.g.
    ```
                        wall        cpu  cpu/wall     frac
     step        :   1.69s      7.15s     4.24   100.00%
      tree      :   0.28s      0.39s     1.40    16.67%
       balance :   0.16s      0.04s     0.26     9.26%
      density   :   0.66s      1.18s     1.81    38.89%
      force     :   0.59s      1.54s     2.60    35.19%
      extf      :   0.12s      0.24s     1.91     7.41%
     write_ev    :
     write_dump  :
    ```
    
    This change makes it easier to perform and visualise detailed timing of communication routines.
    
    - A timer for MPI balancing in tree building has been added to provide an example of multiple nested timers
    - Tree diagram is generated automatically using the hierarchy defined in `setup_timers`
    - All timers are stored in an array of timers in one place, rather than scattered across the code

commit 648188f5564df3b1e83a9a331336212164a53324
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>
Date:   Mon Mar 7 22:00:35 2022 +1100

    Refactor timing routines (#254)
    
    Makes the timing hierarchy clearer using a tree diagram. E.g.
    ```
                        wall        cpu  cpu/wall     frac
     step        :   1.69s      7.15s     4.24   100.00%
      tree      :   0.28s      0.39s     1.40    16.67%
       balance :   0.16s      0.04s     0.26     9.26%
      density   :   0.66s      1.18s     1.81    38.89%
      force     :   0.59s      1.54s     2.60    35.19%
      extf      :   0.12s      0.24s     1.91     7.41%
     write_ev    :
     write_dump  :
    ```
    
    This change makes it easier to perform and visualise detailed timing of communication routines.
    
    - A timer for MPI balancing in tree building has been added to provide an example of multiple nested timers
    - Tree diagram is generated automatically using the hierarchy defined in `setup_timers`
    - All timers are stored in an array of timers in one place, rather than scattered across the code

commit d3e2eac1b17ea5bfdf92b741b916f13468b68a29
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>
Date:   Fri Mar 4 11:03:02 2022 +1100

    adjust tolerance of angmom test for circumbinary disc (#249)
    
    The tolerance of the angular momentum check for the circumbinary disc was set very close to the actual error value. Due to roundoff errors accumulated by MPI, this test can sometimes fail, e.g. https://github.com/danieljprice/phantom/runs/5383936672
    
    The tolerance was adjusted from 3.e-7 to 4.e-7.

commit d61c4daa2ddc48492fb30efa73bde881cf0c529b
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>
Date:   Fri Mar 4 11:03:02 2022 +1100

    adjust tolerance of angmom test for circumbinary disc (#249)
    
    The tolerance of the angular momentum check for the circumbinary disc was set very close to the actual error value. Due to roundoff errors accumulated by MPI, this test can sometimes fail, e.g. https://github.com/danieljprice/phantom/runs/5383936672
    
    The tolerance was adjusted from 3.e-7 to 4.e-7.

commit 87434262d58a094cbc8259bab136b1c5cecfac69
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>
Date:   Fri Mar 4 10:19:26 2022 +1100

    Remove #ifdef MPI from main routines and minor refactoring (#251)
    
    - Small formatting and comment changes
    - Added `#ifdef MPI` around all `use mpi` statements in MPI-related modules, making them safe to call when compiling without MPI
    - Removed `#ifdef MPI` from density, force, and kdtree routines to improve code readability
    - Refactored conditional blocks in density and force to improve code readability
    - Aligned OMP pragmas with code indentation
    - Reorganised public and private variables and routines, hiding unnecessarily public declarations
    - Renamed MPI-related modules to begin with `mpi_`
    - Fixed some compiler warnings related to unused variables
    - Remove unused MPI functions

Merge: 75620a09 0144ef41

commit fade9a7b989980da24d96f48f24fab71f56cb7e1
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>
Date:   Tue Mar 1 13:16:34 2022 +1100

    skip the gather_results step for builds if scheduled action (#248)
    
    https://github.com/danieljprice/phantom/pull/228 added a summary step to the build checks. This always runs, even if the build checks are skipped (scheduled builds on forks). Because no builds have passed, this returns a false fail.
    
    This change causes the workflow to only run the summary step if it is not triggered by a schedule. This will have no effect on scheduled runs on the main repo because the summary step is not used there - it is only used as a branchy protection requirement.

commit 0144ef41a301f79d7606081b00d2c5d179d42ad0
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>
Date:   Tue Mar 1 13:16:34 2022 +1100

    skip the gather_results step for builds if scheduled action (#248)
    
    https://github.com/danieljprice/phantom/pull/228 added a summary step to the build checks. This always runs, even if the build checks are skipped (scheduled builds on forks). Because no builds have passed, this returns a false fail.
    
    This change causes the workflow to only run the summary step if it is not triggered by a schedule. This will have no effect on scheduled runs on the main repo because the summary step is not used there - it is only used as a branchy protection requirement.

commit 88a5071888363dccc6265057ff9961da2c34fa78
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>
Date:   Mon Feb 28 15:43:10 2022 +1100

    remove accradius1_hard hack (#245)
    
    This hard accretion radius hack was introduced in https://github.com/danieljprice/phantom/commit/e54d7350c10c88c7e957227e995b2ff50cb3e3fe to test a scenario in response to a referee's request. It was merged into master, but is not useful in general. It also causes issues elsewhere because boundary particles can be created with no `massoftype set`. @dliptai and @danieljprice have agreed that it should be removed.

commit c9cbda2e349c9c228ad286e0f391859a2993301a
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>
Date:   Mon Feb 28 15:43:10 2022 +1100

    remove accradius1_hard hack (#245)
    
    This hard accretion radius hack was introduced in https://github.com/danieljprice/phantom/commit/e54d7350c10c88c7e957227e995b2ff50cb3e3fe to test a scenario in response to a referee's request. It was merged into master, but is not useful in general. It also causes issues elsewhere because boundary particles can be created with no `massoftype set`. @dliptai and @danieljprice have agreed that it should be removed.

commit a39730a3eea7b34206d57b52c0cfa82b3cfe8bfa
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>
Date:   Tue Feb 22 11:16:51 2022 +1100

    MPI fixes (#243)
    
    Type of PR:
    Bug fix, modifications to existing code
    
    Description:
    This PR includes several bugfixes. 3 fixes have been bundled from other PRs to reduce the testing load once the phantom benchmarks suite has been fixed.
    
    #239:
    Bug introduced in #96 , particles are assigned new IDs if a file without ID is read. IDs are erroneously duplicated across MPI tasks. This is fixed by using an offset to ensure all IDs are unique.
    
    #240:
    `npartoftypetopt=reduceall_mpi('+',npartoftype)` is used in many places in the code, but it is always calculated on the fly. It only needs to be calculated after the number of any particle type on a task has changed. This PR stores it as a global variable in `part`, and defines a subroutine to recalculate it from `npartoftype`.
    
    #241:
    The summary variables `wake`, `floor`, and `tolv` were not reduced across MPI tasks, resulting in incorrect printout. This did not seem to have any effect on the actual results.
    
    Other small bugfixes:
    - replace `MPI_TYPE_STRUCT` with `MPI_TYPE_CREATE_STRUCT`: `MPI_TYPE_STRUCT` was deprecated since MPI 2.0 and replaced with `MPI_TYPE_CREATE_STRUCT`. It has exactly the same interface and does exactly the same thing. And then `MPI_TYPE_STRUCT` was removed from the standard in MPI 3.0 But `MPI_TYPE_STRUCT` still works, but gives the incorrect result
    - reduce `dtextforce` across mpi tasks, and only print to log from the master task
    - remove unused variable declaration (`dtype_old`)
    - reduce box size across MPI tasks in `initial`
    - use `ntot` instead of `npart` for `nskip`, since `npart` is only the local particle count
    - use `ntot` instead of `npart` to print dtlog
    - change particle memory allocation ratio, and make consistent between fortran and hdf5 outputs
    - optimisations to step leapfrog: don't reduce ptmass variables unless necessary
    - use kind=8 for `np` in timestep routines
    
    Testing:
    Full test suite
    
    Did you run the bots? yes

commit 985b3df052d355403ee3016d187a2a79a7bf7f8c
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>

    MPI fixes (#243)

    Bug fix, modifications to existing code
    
    Description:
    This PR includes several bugfixes. 3 fixes have been bundled from other PRs to reduce the testing load once the phantom benchmarks suite has been fixed.
    
    #239:
    Bug introduced in #96 , particles are assigned new IDs if a file without ID is read. IDs are erroneously duplicated across MPI tasks. This is fixed by using an offset to ensure all IDs are unique.

commit e2b7bcdfcb612c348834605cc0663baf518ca674
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>
Date:   Thu Feb 17 13:29:26 2022 +1100

    Test all setups with MPI in the workflow (#217)
    
    Currently, only the testkd setup is tested against MPI. There is also a bug in the action that causes DEBUG=yes to not be tested. This PR adds every test from the serial tests.
    
     - ['test', '']
     - ['testkd', '']
     - ['testdust', 'dust']
     - ['testgr', 'gr']
     - ['testgrav', 'gravity ptmass']
     - ['testgrowth', 'dustgrowth']
     - ['testnimhd', 'nimhd']
     - ['test2', '']
     - ['testcyl', '']
    
    Resolves #210
    
    Resolves #231 by testing:
    
    4 OpenMP tasks - to lift any degeneracies encountered with 2
    4 MPI tasks - to lift any degeneracies encountered with 2
    1 MPI task the trivial case, which should be functionally the same as a non-MPI run, but includes a global tree building step

commit 20779bda587070ca4b2c71bbf2de4d5a7e654133
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>
Date:   Thu Feb 17 11:05:43 2022 +1100

    Fix incorrectly reduced variables in nimhd test (#235)
    
    Type of PR:
    Bug fix
    
    Description:
    Required for #217
    
    In a93bc90e41e7ad7e777d623b81fd6adeff097fd1, as part of implementing MPI support for nimhd tests, the L2 error variables were reduced across tasks.
    
    There is a typo resulting in the `v_x` and `B_y` error being overwritten by the density error. This produces a test failure due to the tolerance not being met.
    
    In df72df1c12c5588a17824ad6e78fe4c581a21e9f, NICIL 2.1 was added to phantom, where the tolerance for `B_y` was changed to `tolb=3.1d-2`. This was change was made possibly because the apparent improved accuracy was wrongly attributed to improvements to the code, rather than because the the density error was overwriting the `B_y` error.
    
    `tolb` has been reverted to the original value of `1.1d-1`.
    
    Testing:
    ```
    make MPI=yes SETUP=testnimhd OPENMP=no phantomtest
    mpirun -n 4 bin/phantomtest nimhd
    ```
    
    Did you run the bots? no, not required

commit eb597d650dfbc4764141f7584c214566c7f658ae
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>
Date:   Thu Feb 17 11:05:43 2022 +1100

    Fix incorrectly reduced variables in nimhd test (#235)
    
    Type of PR:
    Bug fix
    
    Description:
    Required for #217
    
    In a93bc90e41e7ad7e777d623b81fd6adeff097fd1, as part of implementing MPI support for nimhd tests, the L2 error variables were reduced across tasks.
    
    There is a typo resulting in the `v_x` and `B_y` error being overwritten by the density error. This produces a test failure due to the tolerance not being met.
    
    In a4030b178e020b47828a614ac6a64d027a60a485, NICIL 2.1 was added to phantom, where the tolerance for `B_y` was changed to `tolb=3.1d-2`. This was change was made possibly because the apparent improved accuracy was wrongly attributed to improvements to the code, rather than because the the density error was overwriting the `B_y` error.
    
    `tolb` has been reverted to the original value of `1.1d-1`.
    
    Testing:
    ```
    make MPI=yes SETUP=testnimhd OPENMP=no phantomtest
    mpirun -n 4 bin/phantomtest nimhd
    ```
    
    Did you run the bots? no, not required

commit d40b5a69f887895b51538902158d026fa5ce8244
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>
Date:   Thu Feb 17 11:02:49 2022 +1100

    Fix sink potential check (#234)
    
    Type of PR:
    Bug fix
    
    Description:
    Required for #217, discovered when `mpirun -n 4` was added
    
    In ptmass.F90, during sink creation, whether the particle is at the potential minimum is checked:
    ```
           ! CHECK 7: particle i is at minimum in potential
           if (poteni > potenj_min) then
              ifail = inosink_poten
              ifail_array(inosink_poten) = 1
           endif
    ```
    
    This check fails because an identical particle distribution gets created on every task, resulting in close comparisons when determining which particle to create a sink at.
    
    This is fixed by only creating the particles on the master task, and allowing derivs to rebalance them.
    
    `itest` needs to be calculated after calling derivs or else it will be incorrect. The `xcofm` calculation has been removed because the result is not used anywhere.
    
    Testing:
    ```
    make MPI=yes SETUP=testgrav phantomtest
    mpirun -n 4 bin/phantomtest ptmass
    ```
    
    Did you run the bots? yes, pre-commit

commit bb532a47349d0a957d6fdfdf041f3700e36bd67f
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>
Date:   Thu Feb 17 11:02:49 2022 +1100

    Fix sink potential check (#234)
    
    Type of PR:
    Bug fix
    
    Description:
    Required for #217, discovered when `mpirun -n 4` was added
    
    In ptmass.F90, during sink creation, whether the particle is at the potential minimum is checked:
    ```
           ! CHECK 7: particle i is at minimum in potential
           if (poteni > potenj_min) then
              ifail = inosink_poten
              ifail_array(inosink_poten) = 1
           endif
    ```
    
    This check fails because an identical particle distribution gets created on every task, resulting in close comparisons when determining which particle to create a sink at.
    
    This is fixed by only creating the particles on the master task, and allowing derivs to rebalance them.
    
    `itest` needs to be calculated after calling derivs or else it will be incorrect. The `xcofm` calculation has been removed because the result is not used anywhere.
    
    Testing:
    ```
    make MPI=yes SETUP=testgrav phantomtest
    mpirun -n 4 bin/phantomtest ptmass
    ```

    Run test suite using ifort on github runners (#228)
    
    Intel compilers can be installed onto github runners for free, so:
    
    Test and build workflows are now run on github runners to reduce the demand on custom runners. Benchmarks are still run on custom runners.
    Workflows requiring intel compilers can now run on forks.
    Resolves Actions: Use Intel OneAPI compiler to avoid needing custom runners #227
    
    Testing:
    Full test suite
    
    Did you run the bots? no - not required

commit 31d05d81f4d86c63bea41145fd20de60b7ce9ea0
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>
Date:   Mon Feb 14 09:41:18 2022 +1100

    Parallel build action (#224)
    
    Type of PR:
    other
    
    Description:
    The build check action makes each configuration sequentially. Currently there are 93 setups, so this takes about 3 hours to finish. This test slows down development pace because developers must wait a long time for checks on pull requests.
    
    While waiting for build checks on my other PRs to finish, I parallelised the build action 
    
    The maximum github action matrix size is 128. The tests cannot be run individually because all 93 tests have to be run for each compiler, >128. buildbot.sh has been modified to run setups in batches. It takes the argument
    
    ./buildbot.sh --parallel i j
    where j is the number of batches to split the setups into, and the i'th batch is run. For example, --parallel 2 10 will split the setups into 10 batches, and run the 2nd one. To run all the setups, the command must be called j times, for i=1 to i=j. This is split across github runners.
    
    j is set to 32. Using the github runner (for gfortran compiler), the entire build test runs in ~12 minutes, which is ~15x faster. The ifort compiler will be bottlenecked by the number of available custom runners.
    
    A summary job is added to the end of all workflows with a matrix so that the branch protection requirement does not need to be changed when the matrix changes. The requirements build, mpi, test will now cover all tests. Resolves #226
    
    Testing:
    build test continues to run all setups
    
    Did you run the bots? no - not required

commit 3c01dd74c19d4bb5189d66786fb3050c5f585e3f
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>
Date:   Fri Feb 11 11:25:47 2022 +1100

    Use pre-commit framework (#223)
    
    Type of PR:
    modification to existing code
    
    Description:
    The current pre-commit hook allows the commit to proceed, even if changes have been made. It also doesn't distinguish between staged and unstaged changes within the same file.
    
    Use pre-commit framework to run the bots script instead of using a manual bash script. When pre-commit is enabled (completely optional), commits are blocked unless they are bot compliant.
    
    Previously, pre-commit was installed by copying scripts/pre-commit into the git hooks directory. Now it is installed using
    
    pre-commit install
    See https://pre-commit.com
    
    The workflow pre-commit.yml is added, which runs the bots script on push and PRs.
    
    Testing:
    
    Made a change to fortran code that was not bot compliant
    Attempt commit and verify that the commit is stopped, but files were modified
    Stage new changes and attempt commit, which was successful
    Did you run the bots? yes
    
    ---
    
    * exit with non-zero code when files modified
    
    * bots.sh: change to script directory
    
    rather than throwing error about not being in the right directory
    
    * use pre-commit framework instead of manual script
    
    * pre-commit github action
    
    * bots.sh: add option to process just 1 particular file
    
    --file FILENAME
    
    * precommit: pass individual file into bots script
    
    * remove precommit action

commit c7e3b951db4b3b4763becc2b29488a6860692022
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>
Date:   Fri Feb 11 11:21:26 2022 +1100

    MPI: Fix gravity accuracy and tree building (#222)
    
    * adjust potential test tolerances
    
    because they are very close, and changing the order of addition can cause the test to fail
    
    * add reduceall_mpi function for 2-d arrays
    
    * amend previous commit (formatting)
    
    * update directsum gravity test for MPI compatibility
    
    * perform all comparisons on the master task
    
    * [indent-bot] standardised indentation
    
    * update authors list
    
    * wrap balancedomains in #ifdef MPI because it is not compiled in serial
    
    * replace present(remote_export) with its own boolean
    
    for improved code clarity
    formatting: amend previous commit
    
    * labelling if clause for clarity
    
    * improve code clarity by specifying global_build variable
    
    instead of relying on present(groupsize)
    
    * synchronise child cell limits during tree build
    
    this fixes a problem where the limits are not passed down to the level, resulting in splitting along the wrong axis
    
    * tidy comments and formatting
    
    * remove local_gravity variable
    
    whether the gravitational contribution of remote particles should be included is already determined from the presence of remote_export. define a bool global_search to make this more explicit
    amend previous commit: formatting
    
    * Rewrite interface to tree_sync to manually pass in array lengths
    
    fixes a bug where children of nodes do not get synced properly when using 1 mpi task
    amend previous commit: formatting
    
    * amend code comment
    
    * fix double counting of gravitational potential
    
    when using MPI and not expanding a node
    
    * fix array bound mismatch error
    
    due fxyz_ptmass and fxyz_ptmass_gas being allocated different sizes, the slice needs to be specified explicitly
    
    * add real4arr2 version of reduceall_mpi
    
    and tidy formatting
    
    * amend previous commit: formatting
    
    * syntax fix with preprocessor order

commit d23f8022e83199f00623292021c74e04c8af3d84
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>
Date:   Wed Feb 2 16:40:56 2022 +1100

    use npartoftypetot in init_evfile
    
    When using MPI. npartoftype is different on each task. In some cases, iquantities can be different, causing MPI_allreduce calls to be mismatched due to if statements. This results in incorrect results, and also causes the code to hang.

commit 37bcbab263ffa54f4abfd6ff1953eeb41e8c5987
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>

commit 46870b57eb00d3649f9531a628b252fd9a5434b5
Author: Daniel Mentiplay <daniel.mentiplay@protonmail.com>
Date:   Thu May 7 10:26:39 2020 +1000

    Fix crash in printing timesteps for large ntypes
    
    For large numbers of types, for example, with multiple dust species as
    separate sets of particles, the variable "fmtstring2" is now written
    correctly, fixing the runtime error it caused. The issues was that the
    value of the expression "17 + 32 + 11*ntypesprint" can be greater than
    99 and so the format string for "fmtstring2" must use "i3" not "i2".
    (The number refers to the number of decimal digits in the integer.)

    library to fail if using HDF5, for example in building phantomsetup.
    This commit still requires dynamic linking against the HDF5 libraries.

Date:   Thu Apr 16 11:54:29 2020 +1000

    Add ieos and idustbound to HDF5 read/write
    
    This allows for the same logic to write pressure depending on equation
    of state as the standard `readwrite_dumps`. Adding `idustbound` is
    required to read dumps with dust boundary particles.
    
    Plus a tidy up of the code.

commit e0d6986df99d980267f712d2218376dd50701117
Author: Daniel Mentiplay <daniel.mentiplay@protonmail.com>
Date:   Wed Feb 12 10:56:28 2020 +1100

    Fix reading runtime params in HDF5 dump header
    
    Some run time parameters such as, `tolh`, `C_cour`, `C_force`, etc. were
    being read from the HDF5 dump file and set there. When they should be
    read from the infile. Now they are read from file but the values are not
    used to set their values globally. The values do not need to be read but
    this follows the code as written for "regular" Phantom dump files in
    `readwrite_dumps.F90`.

    step_leapfrog : reorganize call evolve_dust and coupling when NUCLEATION
    wind : fix dimension of JKmuS, call calc_alpha_dust and calc_kappa_dust changed
    ptmass_radiation : fix unit, adapt calls following the change in arguments of calc_* routines

commit 7c0bd3aa7ea65c16e3bea1ba6ec2c2c49e466e16
Author: Daniel Mentiplay <daniel.mentiplay@protonmail.com>
Date:   Mon Dec 16 11:27:40 2019 +1100

    Add multiple K_code drag
    
    This allows for multigrain dust with constant drag for each dust
    species. K_code is set in the infile. There is one `K_code` per species.
    For a single species the variable is `K_code`. For multiple species,
    there are multiple variables like `K_code1`, `K_code2`, and so on.

commit cacfa414fe7a6bc2dfca29c9e248245fca4ffa25
Author: Daniel Mentiplay <daniel.mentiplay@protonmail.com>
Date:   Tue Jul 2 19:00:25 2019 +1000

    (hdf5) added externalforces values to header
    
    For some values of iexternalforce extra values are written to the
    header. These were not previously written for HDF5 files. Now they are.
    They are written as a subgroup to the header group.

commit bf79304ff1f2eb3ab42bd6ea15d18e082924f095
Author: Daniel Mentiplay <daniel.mentiplay@protonmail.com>
Date:   Tue Jul 2 18:57:39 2019 +1000

    (setup) Initialize externalforce for check_setup
    
    Without calling update_externalforce x1, x2, y1, y2 are not set for
    module extern_binary, and binary_accreted which relies on these values
    being present is called in check_setup, beore update_externalforce is
    called.

Date:   Fri May 24 20:50:30 2019 +1000

commit 1e5ac0bdac0e8691fce42080f9a2b8c3550c1bfc
Author: David Liptai <dliptai@swin.edu.au>
Date:   Fri Nov 16 14:57:22 2018 +1100

    (GR) inject_bondi: use 'real' gas particles instead of boundary particles for handled spheres. This is because I had a problem with velocities at the boundary between boundary spheres and real injected particles. Changing them to real particles (so that density was calculated on them) seemed to fix the issue.

    Merge remote-tracking branch 'upstream/master'
    
    * upstream/master: (271 commits)
      [author-bot] updated AUTHORS file
      [space-bot] whitespace at end of lines removed
      reduced timestep from physical viscosity force by factor 0.4: this has been found to lead to much better convergence of disc simulations that use this method
      [indent-bot] standardised indentation
      [author-bot] updated AUTHORS file
      [author-bot] updated AUTHORS file
      Sends error code to system if a fatal error happens
      [author-bot] updated AUTHORS file
      clean up of mac OSX gfortran SYSTEM, also 7.3.0 tested
      (makefile) you can now supply JOBNAME=<your-job-name> when making job scripts with make qscript, otherwise it continues to just make a random word
      [indent-bot] standardised indentation
      [header-bot] updated file headers
      (ev2mdot) fixed bug that arose when providing a dt to average over
      precession files: these can now be made even if the first file input is not the first file of the simulation
      (get_total_angular_momentum) do not include dead or accreted particles - they are taken into account with the sinks if they are accreted in any case
      (set_disc) added an explicit message that *.discparams is not read by the setup routine
      (utils_disc) now handles an eccentric disc - bins are defined by semi-major axis, not by radius
      (disc_analysis) deleted nr as a parameter at top, it is fed in as an input anyway
      (dustgrowth) added ifrag=-1 to study computational time scale impact
      [author-bot] updated AUTHORS file
      ...

commit 660a5492fdc88335ced7f4f61f2ab142d22a79ec
Author: Nicolas Cuello <cuellonicolas@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Jul 25 14:49:12 2018 -0400

    Flyby setup updated with the following roll angle convention:
    incl=0 => prograde orbit (disc and perturber anti-clockwise)
    incl=180 => retrograde orbit (disc anti- and perturber clockwise)
    NB: clock-wise rotation in the zx-plane, so a polar perturber (90)
    arrives from below and leaves above the disc midplane.

commit bfaa69908cd1a4aec11b0a1153e609a39bd055aa
Author: Mark Hutchison <markahutch@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Jun 20 00:54:41 2018 +0200

    (dustydisc) bug fix optional fileid parameter not being set correctly in get_onefluiddust. Also removed dust_method as interactive setup option (one-fluid is the new default) and automatically switches to two-fluid if it detects 10% of the particles have stopping times greater than a threshold value. Users can otherwise force Phantom to use one-fluid dust by setting the environment variable IFORCE_DUST_METHOD=yes.

    Revert "(dynamicmem) use conditionals to specify array size"
    
    This reverts commit 7bf0d3d42b2a9173ab9b826ba6ce5dded4ce7b62.

commit 7bf0d3d42b2a9173ab9b826ba6ce5dded4ce7b62
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>
Date:   Fri May 4 14:12:33 2018 +1000

    (dynamicmem) use conditionals to specify array size
    
    Explicit is better than implicit: instead of using a 'max_' variable, use the preprocessor flags to set a logical in the same routine which decides if an array is allocated or not. Arrays are always 0 or maxp.

    (io) bugfix: fix array skipping
    
    Array skipping relies on nums to determine how far ahead to skip. With some configurations, not all of nums is written, and when nums is not initialized as 0, will not skip the correct distance.

commit e54d7350c10c88c7e957227e995b2ff50cb3e3fe
Author: David Liptai <dliptai@swin.edu.au>
Date:   Tue Sep 19 16:23:23 2017 +1000

    (GR) Bondi accretion: setup for ISOTHERMAL in GR and non-GR cases. Added 'inner' and 'outer' accretion radius for external force. Particles entering outer accretion radius turn into boundary particles and then only go inactive when they cross the inner accretion radius. Particles on the outer edge of the sphere are also boundary particles, in order to try and force some sort of boundary condition (not necessarily correct).

commit bc96b748692a95f735c79f89fb94cfd50eaa13b4
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>
Date:   Thu Jun 15 22:31:18 2017 +1000

    (mpi) optimized memory management for MPI communication
    
    Allocate arrays used for communication as a single contiguous array, and then suballocate into individual pieces.
    
    Benefits:
    - Zero data movement necessary for stack swap in density iterations - this is now handled by an address switch
    - Foundations for future memory optimizations and dynamic communication array resizing

commit f517792730f7f006da9467b05459885d1eeeff8d
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>
Date:   Thu Jun 15 13:45:08 2017 +1000

    (mpi) fix rwdump not reading npartoftype properly
    
    Fixes rwdump test. Current implementation is conditional on MPI dumps. This change may not work for dumsp that are not nblocks==1. Should be eventually rewritten.
    
    (mpi) append to previous commit

commit 78d8433b2ce587b463fde35922c52ec539f3febf
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>
Date:   Sat Jun 10 12:44:58 2017 +1000

    (mpi) fix crashes for pathological arrangements, better load balancing
    
    If the simulation domain does not well match the particle configuration, the first split may be poorly balanced, and at worst, all particles may end up on one half of the processors, causing a crash. To resolve this, always compute actual min/max position values when constructing root node.

commit 310697478aaade7a2b2b409773727a8cd73467a9
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>
Date:   Fri May 5 11:32:47 2017 +1000

    (kdtree) fix for very deep unbalanced trees
    For highly regular particle configurations such as ICs, tree construction may identify the wrong axis to pivot. Resolved by using actual box occupied by particles in a node, instead of splitting previous node in half.

commit 0e70504f90f41c5bc234c3e52f55be3585468ca3
Author: Simon Glover <glover@uni-heidelberg.de>
Date:   Wed Apr 26 14:50:41 2017 +0200

    Add CO rotational cooling

commit 689b634befe072d2803279c2bf70b8437ab4189e
Author: Simon Glover <glover@uni-heidelberg.de>
Date:   Wed Apr 26 13:10:32 2017 +0200

     Make velocity divergence available to cooling function
    
     Our treatment of CO cooling is a large velocity gradient (LVG) approximation, and
     we therefore need an estimate of the velocity gradient, which we can get most easily
     from the velocity divergence. This commit adds the code necessary to get this value
     to where we need it (and in the process ensures that we convert from code to cgs units).

Author: Daniel Price <daniel.price@monash.edu>
Date:   Thu Apr 13 00:30:33 2017 +1000

    [header-bot] updated file headers

commit 1153598149e137f37ee5cd69adcefd4d79393b80
Author: Conrad Chan <conradchan@hotmail.com.au>
Date:   Wed Apr 12 15:50:40 2017 +1000

    (mpi) fix missing particles problem
    Old implementation was not safe, dependent on MPI implementation. Completion signal could arrive before all particles have been received.
    Fix: Send completion signal using the same comm as particles. Relying on order preservation of messages, this ensures the completion signal doesnt get processed before all of the particles.
